H0.text: who is considered the father of modern cosmology. Albert Einstein

H1.text: who is considered the father of modern cosmology. Georges Lemaitre

H2.text: who is considered the father of modern cosmology. Arthur Eddington

H3.text: who is considered the father of modern cosmology. Edwin Hubble

A4.text: Georges Lemaître was the first to argue that the recession of galaxies is evidence of an expanding universe.

A5.text: In 1929, the US astronomer Edwin Hubble published a paper in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America showing, based on better and more abundant data than what Lemaître had had at his disposal in 1927, that, in the average, galaxies recede at a velocity proportional to their distance from the observer.

A6.text: Georges Lemaître, Father of the Big Bang theory
